cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (forecast to become a hurricane)
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north then accelerating north-northeast across the eastern Gulf, aiming for Florida’s Big Bend, then crossing southeast Georgia toward the Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key / Indian Pass area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Englewood to Indian Pass, FL; Tropical Storm Watch south of Englewood to Chokoloskee, FL and Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Pinar del Rio, Cuba; Tropical Storm Warning Yucatan Peninsula Tulum–Rio Lagartos, Isle of Youth, Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast (especially Big Bend), then southeast Georgia and the eastern Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (34–50 kt probabilities up to 73% / 37%) Wednesday night–Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow as the cyclone exits may push 2–4 ft of surge into the Georgia barrier islands and sounds
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts possible Tuesday night through Thursday, creating flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; rough surf and dangerous rip currents
